item.title: 日经新闻》称，作为重组的一部分，日产将暂停部分国内工厂的运营
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周二报道，作为业务重组努力的一部分，日本日产汽车公司决定暂停部分国内工厂的运营。【原文：Japan's Nissan Motor has decided to suspend operations at some domestic factories as part of a business restructuring effort, the Nikkei business daily reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 2025 年，CATL 将在全球最大规模的上市活动中为银行提供低廉的费用
item.description: 处理今年迄今为止全球最大上市交易的投资银行将获得远低于行业标准的承销费，在上市交易长期低迷之后，顾问们愿意忍受微薄的利润来赢得业务。【原文：Investment banks handling the world's largest listing so far this year are set to earn underwriting fees well below the industry norm, with advisers willing to endure skinny margins to win business following a prolonged slump in listings.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：美国贸易休战后，中国取消了对波音公司的交货禁令
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，在与美国达成贸易休战协议后，中国取消了对航空公司接收波音飞机的禁令。【原文：China has removed a ban on airlines taking delivery of Boeing planes following a trade truce with the United States, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：在美国关税谈判之际，越南加大打击进口假冒产品的力度
item.description: 路透社查阅的文件显示，在美国指责越南是假冒伪劣和数字盗版的主要集散地并威胁要征收严厉的关税之后，越南正在加大打击假冒伪劣和数字盗版的力度。【原文：Vietnam is stepping up its fight against counterfeits and digital piracy after the United States accused the country of being a major hub for these illegal activities and threatened crippling tariffs, documents reviewed by Reuters show.】

item.title: 美国将对中国货物征收的 "最低 "关税从 120% 下调至 54
item.description: 白宫的一项行政命令称，美国将从 5 月 14 日起把对中国货物征收的 "最低 "关税从 120% 下调至 54%，并继续征收最低 100 美元的统一关税。【原文：A White House executive order said that the U.S. would cut the "de minimis" tariff on China shipments to 54% from 120%, with a minimum flat fee of $100 to remain starting from May 14.】

item.title: 财富管理平台 Addepar 在新一轮融资中估值 32.5 亿美元
item.description: 财富管理平台提供商 Addepar 在新一轮 2.3 亿美元的融资中创下了 32.5 亿美元的估值，这得益于金融顾问们争相在动荡的市场中为富裕客户提供更好的数据。【原文：Wealth management platform provider Addepar has hit a valuation of $3.25 billion in a fresh $230 million funding round, as it benefits from a race by financial advisors to arm wealthy clients with better data in volatile markets.】

item.title: 欧洲央行在战略审查中坚持过去的刺激政策
item.description: 欧洲央行的几位决策者告诉路透社记者，欧洲央行将在一次战略审查中坚持其过去十年的激进刺激政策，回避在一轮高通胀和巨额亏损之后进行自我批评的呼声。【原文：The European Central Bank will stand by its aggressive stimulus policy of the last decade in a strategy review, side-stepping calls for self-criticism after a bout of high inflation and sizeable losses, several ECB policymakers told Reuters.】

item.title: 欧洲 贸易战暂歇，重回磨合期
item.description: 洛基-斯威夫特对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rocky Swift】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：停电后，西班牙调查小型发电厂的网络漏洞
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周二报道，西班牙正在要求小型发电企业提供有关其网络防御的信息，因为调查上个月大停电事件的调查人员试图确定它们是否是被坏人利用来瘫痪该国电网的薄弱环节。【原文：Spain is demanding information from small electricity generators on their cyber defences as investigators probing last month’s blackout seek to determine whether they were a weak link exploited by bad actors to bring down the country’s power grid, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚养老基金开始质疑美国战略
item.description: 由于对美国经济增长的信心减弱，澳大利亚 4.2 万亿澳元（约合 2.7 万亿美元）养老金领域的基金正在重新考虑其长期坚持的购买美国资产和美元的一些策略。【原文：Funds in Australia's A$4.2 trillion ($2.7 trillion) pension sector are rethinking some of their long-held strategies of buying U.S. assets and the dollar, as confidence in American growth wanes.】

item.title: 印度向世贸组织提交的通知显示，印度拟对美国征收反关税
item.description: 印度向世界贸易组织（WTO）表示，印度拟对美国生产并运往印度的部分产品征收关税，以对抗华盛顿对亚洲第三大经济体生产的钢铁和铝产品征收的关税。【原文：India has told the World Trade Organisation (WTO) that it proposes to levy duties on some products made in the U.S. and shipped to India, to counter Washington's tariffs on steel and aluminium products produced in Asia's No.3 economy.】

item.title: 洞察力：中国的人工智能仿人机器人旨在改变制造业
item.description: 在上海郊区一个庞大的仓库里，数十个仿人机器人在操作员的操纵下，一遍又一遍地执行着折叠 T 恤、制作三明治和开门等任务。【原文：In a sprawling warehouse in a Shanghai suburb, dozens of humanoid robots are manoeuvred by their operators to carry out tasks like folding a T-shirt, making a sandwich and opening doors, over and over again.】

item.title: 2024 年中拉贸易额突破 5000 亿美元
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平周二表示，去年中拉贸易额首次超过 5000 亿美元。【原文：Trade between China and Latin America exceeded $500 billion for the first time last year, China's President Xi Jinping said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中美贸易战暂停提振风险偏好，亚洲市场欢呼雀跃
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市加入了全球股市反弹的行列，美元则守住了大部分涨幅，因为中美贸易战暂时停息缓解了市场对全球经济衰退的担忧，令投资者松了一口气。【原文：Asian stocks joined the global rally and the U.S. dollar held on to most of its gains on Tuesday as investors heaved a sigh of relief after a temporary halt in the trade war between the U.S. and China eased worries of a global recession.】

item.title: 美元坚守中美贸易协定带来的涨势
item.description: 美元周二保持强劲涨势，原因是投资者对美国和中国达成关税协议表示欢迎，该协议为世界两大经济体之间的贸易战踩下了刹车，而这场贸易战曾引发对全球经济衰退的担忧。【原文：The dollar held strong gains on Tuesday as investors cheered a tariff deal between the United States and China to tap the brakes on a trade war between the world's two largest economies that had fed fears of a global recession.】

item.title: 澳大利亚消费者信心从关税打击中部分恢复
item.description: 随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普发动关税战的最初冲击略有减弱，衡量澳大利亚消费者情绪的一项指标在5月份出现部分反弹。【原文：A measure of Australian consumer sentiment partially rebounded in May as the initial shock of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff war faded a little, an improvement that should be underpinned by the latest truce with China.】

item.title: 中美暂停关税战，油价从两周高点回落
item.description: 美国和中国同意暂时削减关税，引发了对世界两大经济体之间的贸易战即将结束的乐观情绪，油价周二从上一交易日触及的两周高点回落。【原文：Oil prices eased on Tuesday from a two-week high reached during the previous session after the U.S. and China agreed to temporarily slash tariffs, sparking optimism that a trade war between the world's two biggest economies would come to an end.】

item.title: 北斗星为香港数据中心扩建获得融资
item.description: 北斗数据中心（BDx Data Centers）周二表示，该公司已获得基础设施信贷公司 Clifford Capital、新加坡大华银行和日本三井住友银行的项目融资，用于在香港开发首个超大规模数据中心。【原文：BDx Data Centers said on Tuesday that it has secured project financing from infrastructure credit firm Clifford Capital, Singapore's United Overseas Bank and Japan's Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation for the development of its first hyperscale data centre in Hong Kong.】

item.title: 日本央行部分官员认为有恢复加息的余地，3 月份总结显示
item.description: 周二，日本央行 4 月 30 日至 5 月 1 日政策会议的意见摘要显示，一些日本央行董事会成员认为，如果美国关税问题的发展趋于稳定，那么在暂时暂停加息后仍有恢复加息的余地。【原文：Some Bank of Japan board members saw scope to resume interest rate hikes after a temporary pause if developments over U.S. tariffs stabilise, a summary of opinions at their April 30-May 1 policy meeting showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国众议院共和党人寻求取消电动汽车税收抵免和贷款计划
item.description: 美国众议院共和党人周一提议取消电动汽车税收抵免，并废除旨在促使汽车制造商生产更多零排放汽车的燃油效率规定，作为基础广泛的税制改革法案的一部分。【原文：Republicans in the U.S. House of Representatives on Monday proposed killing the electric vehicle tax credit and repealing fuel efficiency rules designed to prod automakers into building more zero-emission vehicles as part of a broad-based tax reform bill.】

item.title: 三星推出最薄智能手机，与竞争对手苹果展开竞争
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）周二发布了迄今为止最薄的旗舰机型，该机型配备了增强型人工智能功能，以求在高端市场超越竞争对手苹果公司。【原文：Samsung Electronics made public on Tuesday its slimmest flagship model to date, complete with enhanced artificial intelligence features, as it seeks to get ahead of rival Apple on the premium market.】

item.title: 埃利奥特在菲利普斯 66 代理权争夺战中赢得 ISS 支持
item.description: 周一，埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）在与菲利普斯 66 公司（Phillips 66）的董事会斗争中取得了胜利，著名代理咨询公司机构股东服务公司（ISS）建议投资者选举该激进派提名的全部四名董事。【原文：Elliott Investment Management scored a victory on Monday in its board fight at Phillips 66 when prominent proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommended that investors elect all four of the activist's director nominees.】

item.title: 巴西化妆品制造商 Natura 第一季度净亏损减少 84
item.description: 巴西化妆品制造商 Natura 周一公布，第一季度净亏损为 1.507 亿雷亚尔（约合 2660 万美元），比去年同期缩小 83.9%。【原文：Brazilian cosmetic maker Natura posted on Monday a first-quarter net loss of 150.7 million reais ($26.6 million), 83.9% narrower than a year earlier.】

item.title: 中国电商巨头在快速交付上押下昂贵赌注
item.description: 中国电子商务巨头阿里巴巴和京东在持续的市场份额争夺战中开辟了一条新战线，两家公司今年都在积极拓展以30至60分钟送达速度为核心的所谓即时零售业务。【原文：Chinese e-commerce giants Alibaba and JD.com have opened a new front in the ongoing battle for market share, with both expanding aggressively into so-called instant retail centred around delivery speeds of 30 to 60 minutes this year.】

item.title: 美国医疗保险计划制定第三轮药品价格谈判时间表
item.description: 美国医疗保险与医疗补助服务中心（CMS）周一表示，它将在明年 2 月初公布有资格参加第三轮医疗保险价格谈判的 15 种药品名单。【原文：The U.S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) said on Monday that it would announce a list of 15 drugs eligible for a third round of Medicare price negotiations by early February next year.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，谷歌正在年度会议之前开发人工智能代理软件
item.description: 据 The Information 周一报道，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司在其年度开发者大会之前向员工和外部开发者展示了一系列不同的产品，其中包括用于软件开发的人工智能代理。【原文：Alphabet's Google has been demonstrating to employees and outside developers an array of different products, including an AI agent for software development, ahead of its annual developer conference, The Information reported on Monday.】

item.title: 乔恩-沃伊特、好莱坞联盟要求特朗普考虑税收优惠政策
item.description: 据路透社周一看到的一封信称，由美国电影业工会和公会组成的联盟在老牌演员乔恩-沃伊特（Jon Voight）的加入下，要求美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在推动国内电影制作的过程中考虑实施税收优惠政策。【原文：A coalition of American film industry unions and guilds, joined by veteran actor Jon Voight, has asked U.S. President Donald Trump to consider implementing tax incentives in his push to promote domestic film productions, according to a letter seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 交易日：关税休战改变市场 "游戏规则
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 特朗普的药品定价令打击了药房福利管理公司
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统周一在其关于药品定价的行政命令中打击了负责谈判美国药品价格的私营部门中间商，称他将把这些中间商排除在外，作为使美国与其他国家保持一致的目标的一部分。【原文：President Donald Trump on Monday delivered a blow to the private-sector middlemen who negotiate U.S. drug prices in his executive order on drug pricing, saying he would cut them out as part of a goal to bring the U.S. in line with other countries.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯将在阿拉巴马州工厂增产 GLC SUV
item.description: 梅赛德斯高管周一表示，公司将在阿拉巴马州塔斯卡卢萨的工厂为北美地区增产 GLC SUV。【原文：Mercedes executives on Monday said the company will add production of its GLC SUV for North America at its plant in Tuscaloosa, Alabama.】
